3.93. 
Permission to conclude transactions 
1. If one spouse does not give the consent of the other to enter into a transaction which requires the consent of the other spouse, the spouse concerned may apply to the court for permission to enter into such a transaction. 
2. The court shall only authorise the transaction if the spouse concerned proves that the transaction is necessary to meet the needs of the family or of the joint business of the spouses.
